qas.question: In the 20th century most people practiced some form of what faith?
What religion was adopted by the population in the early 21st century?
What percentage of the population now practices Islam?
What denomination are the majority of Guinea-Bissau's muslims?
What sect does 2% of the population belong to?

context: Throughout the 20th century, most Bissau-Guineans practiced some form of <a0_0>Animism.<a0_0/> In the early 21st century, many have adopted <a1_0>Islam<a1_0/>, which is now practiced by <a2_0>50%<a2_0/> of the country's population. Most of Guinea-Bissau's Muslims are of the <a3_0>Sunni<a3_0/> denomination with approximately 2% belonging to the <a4_0>Ahmadiyya<a4_0/> sect.
